intro: Mentzelia longiloba var. chihuahuaensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. The plant features showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. The species is part of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators in its native range.
